page.title: 15ASHTON - A MODEL VILLAGE
page.content: Ashton is situated near to the River Nene and is surrounded by a large amount of agricultural land. The new by-pass is to run near it. The small picturesque cottages were rebuilt in 1900 out of stone and were given thatched roofs. They were built for {Ashton Estate}workers. Some are now holiday homes which tourists may rent. There is a also a pub{'The Chequered {Skipper'}and a small chapel which dates back to the 18th century. Many of the 90 inhabitants work on the Ashton Estate. The estate land is not open to the public which is a pity because the countryside is very pleasant. Every year the{World Conker {Championships}take place on the village green. This event attracts many visitors. The mill just outside the village also attracts visitors because its is now a{fish-museum.
